text.0: praise of the asura high imperial ruler the manly one in whom the folk shall triumph.
text.1: i laud his deeds who is as strong as indra and lauding celebrate the fortdestroyer.
text.2: sage sing food lightthey bring him from the mountain the blessed sovran of the earth and heaven.
text.3: i decorate with songs the mighty actions which agni fortdestroyer did aforetime.
text.4: the foolish faithless rudelyspeaking niggards without belief or sacrifice or worship.
text.5: far far sway hath agni chased those dasytis and in the cast hath turned the godless westward.
text.6: him who brought eastward manliest with his prowess the maids rejoicing in the western darkness.
text.7: that agni i extol the lord of riches unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.
text.8: him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons and gave the mornings to anoble husband.
text.9: young agni who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of nahus made them bring their tribute.
text.10: in whose protection all men rest by nature desiring to enjoy his gracious favour.
text.11: agni vaiśvānara in his parents bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.
text.12: vaiśvānara the god at the suns setting hath taken to himself deephidden treasures.
text.13: agni hath taken them from earth and heaven from the sea under and the sea above us.
